meanings.sent1: The factory owner was proletarianising the workers by reducing their wages.
meanings.sent2: The government's policies were proletarianising the middle class, pushing them into the working class.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved proletarianising a rabbit into a hardworking laborer.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes were proletarianising the canvas, transforming it into a representation of the working class struggle.
meanings.sent5: The potion had a mysterious effect, proletarianising anyone who drank it into a blue-collar worker.

meanings.definition: To cause to become part of the proletariat.
meanings.sent1: The new laws were proletarianising many previously affluent families.
meanings.sent2: The economic downturn was proletarianising a large segment of the population.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected inheritance was proletarianising the once wealthy heiress.
meanings.sent4: The social movement was proletarianising individuals from all walks of life.
meanings.sent5: The contagious idea was proletarianising minds, uniting them in the struggle for equality.
